summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, commanding an unnamed recipient to appear before the grand jury on August 20, 2019, and to produce all materials relating to Jeffrey Epstein. The subpoena includes a rider detailing the recipient's rights and specifying the scope of documents required.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.role: United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: He is the signatory of the grand jury subpoena, dated August 15, 2019, commanding the recipient to appear and produce documents.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subpoena demands the production of all materials relating to him, indicating he is the central figure in the grand jury investigation.

connections.description: Berman, as U.S. Attorney, is issuing a subpoena to gather evidence for a grand jury investigation into Epstein.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance
events.description: The unnamed recipient is commanded to appear before the grand jury to testify and give evidence regarding alleged violations of federal law.

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Borough of Manhattan, City of New York, New York
One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: A grand jury subpoena was issued on August 15, 2019, for an appearance on August 20, 2019, indicating active federal investigation into Jeffrey Epstein post-arrest.
The subpoena demands production of all materials relating to Jeffrey Epstein, including text messages, emails, social media messages, documents, and notes.
The alleged violations under investigation include 18 U.S.C. §§ 371 (conspiracy), 1001 (false statements), and 1519 (destruction, alteration, or falsification of records).
The recipient of the subpoena is not named in the provided text, indicating it is a redacted or separate document.
The subpoena explicitly covers electronically stored material on devices and accounts, including those in foreign jurisdictions, showing a broad evidence-gathering scope.
